caption.p: Separation of compounds by polarity-stepwise elution counter-current chromatography (CCC). Solvent methanol/water (1:5, v/ v) was used as the stationary phase. Ten compounds from the 70% methanol extract of M. volcanica, with polarities from low to high, were sequentially separated or fractionated by polarity-stepwise elution CCC using five mobile phases at 3 mL/min as follows: mobile phase I, n-hexane/ethyl acetate 3:5, v/ v, 350–600 mL; mobile phase II, n-hexane/ethyl acetate 2:5, v/ v, 600–970 mL; mobile phase III, n-hexane/ethyl acetate 1:5, v/ v, 970–1340 mL; mobile phase IV, ethyl acetate, 1340–1480 mL; mobile phase V, ethyl acetate/ n-butanol 4:1, v/ v, 1480–1890 mL. The n-butanol used was pre-saturated with water in the present study. The eluate was monitored at 225 nm (line) and 250 nm (rectangle) and automatically collected according to 250 nm.
